_instructions.title: SALON HOURS SETUP GUIDE
_instructions.subtitle: Easy instructions for setting your salon's operating hours
_instructions.important_note: ⚠️ PLEASE READ ALL INSTRUCTIONS BEFORE MAKING CHANGES ⚠️

step_1.title: Understanding Time Format
step_1.description: All times must be written in 24-hour format (military time)
step_1.conversion_tip: For afternoon times, add 12 to the hour (1 PM = 13:00, 2 PM = 14:00, etc.)

step_2.title: Setting Daily Hours
step_2.description: For each day of the week, you can set:

open_day.description: If your salon is open that day

closed_day.description: If your salon is closed that day

step_3.title: Adding Holidays
step_3.description: To close for holidays, add them to the holidays section

format.name: Holiday name (like Christmas Day)
format.isOpen: false for closed, true if you're open

step_5.title: Countdown Timer Settings
step_5.description: Control when the closing soon countdown appears
step_5.explanation: Number of minutes before closing to show the countdown timer

countdown_not_showing.problem: Countdown timer doesn't appear when salon is about to close
solutions: Make sure your computer's time zone is set correctly
Check that closingSoonWarning is set to a reasonable number (60-120 minutes)
Verify your closing time is in correct 24-hour format
Refresh your website after making changes
Double-check your time format (must be 24-hour like 18:00, not 6:00)
Make sure isOpen is set to true/false (not True/False)
Check for holidays or vacation dates that might override regular hours
Verify today's day of the week has correct settings
Don't use AM/PM - use 24-hour format only

safety_reminders.backup: Always save a copy of your working hours before making changes
safety_reminders.test: After making changes, check your website to make sure everything works
safety_reminders.format: Be very careful with commas, quotes, and brackets - they must be exactly right
safety_reminders.help: If you break something, you can always restore from the backup copy
